alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 2:36PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Interior Sonoma County in northern California. * WHEN...Until 830 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 PM PDT, the heaviest rainfall has ended across the area. However, Colgan Creek near Sebastopol and Green Valley Creek at Martinelli Road are currently in minor flood stage. Additionally, Mark West Creek near Mirabel Heights is currently rising and is expected to go into monitor stage later this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Sebastopol, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
